item.title: Classes
item.description: As our applications grow in features and complexity, we need to organize our code a little better. We cannot just throw everything inside ofApp as it quickly becomes unwieldy and hard to navigate. We can use classes to separate our app functionality into different modules. A class is a structure that contains variables and functions as members. A class is the definition of this structure. An object is an instance of the class.

item.title: Mobile Development
item.description: One of the strengths of openFrameworks is that it runs on a multitude of platforms. We can usually run our apps on Android or iOS with minimal modifications. iOS # OF runs on most iOS platforms, including iPhones, iPads, and Apple TVs. Requirements # A Mac and Xcode to compile apps for iOS. Xcode does not need any additional modules, it should already include all necessary libraries and applications. An Apple ID.
